availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Ross (Gallatin County, Kentucky, farmer and fugitive.)

body.p: Gallatin County, Kentucky, farmer and fugitive from justice. Farmer in Gallatin County, Kentucky, in 1859. Shot William H. Kelly in Gallatin County on July 6, 1859. Indicted for the murder of William H. Kelly in Gallatin Circuit Court. Escaped from the Gallatin County Jail on March 1, 1860. Arrested near the Virginia border in 1860. Escaped from the Gallatin County Jail on September 12, 1860. Fugitive from justice in Missouri in 1864.

ab.bibl:
"Another Cold Blooded Murder," Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, KY), July 9, 1859, p. 1.
"Warsaw Jail Broken Open," Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, KY), March 5, 1860, p. 1.
"Second Escape of a Murderer," Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, KY), September 17, 1860, p. 1.
KYR-0001-006-0024.
